EmailTemplate.subject: eWeekly – Aloha Online Ordering Migrating to Public Cloud
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
October 22, 2020 Migration of Aloha Online Ordering to Public Cloud We are excited to announce the migration of Aloha Online Ordering to the public cloud to best meet growing demand and further modernize our architecture. The migration to the new cloud environment started this week and will take place during regularly scheduled maintenance windows, so there will not be any disruption in service.
A communication was sent to all impacted customers explaining the administrative changes they must make to access Web Admin and Menu Configurator after their Aloha Online Ordering site has been migrated.
Decommission of NCR Dallas Data Center for NCR Mobile Pay Only
In 2019, NCR successfully went live with its hosted services in the Microsoft Azure Public Cloud. As such, NCR plans to permanently decommission our Dallas Data Center for NCR Mobile Pay only. We are planning to move other applications out of the Dallas Data Center in the future as well and will keep you informed as we get closer to the date.NCR Mobile Pay clients utilizing the Dallas (DFW05) Data Center must whitelist their NCR endpoints before Friday, November 6th, 2020 or they will be at risk of losing access to their licensed NCR Mobile Pay products that are hosted in the Dallas Data Center.
